verses.translation: I swear by this city, Makkah -
And you, [O Muhammad], are free of restriction in this city -
And [by] the father and that which was born [of him],
We have certainly created man into hardship.

verses.arabic: أَیَحۡسَبُ أَن لَّن یَقۡدِرَ عَلَیۡهِ أَحَدࣱ
verses.translation: Does he think that never will anyone overcome him?
He says, "I have spent wealth in abundance."
Does he think that no one has seen him?
Have We not made for him two eyes?
And a tongue and two lips?
And have shown him the two ways?
But he has not broken through the difficult pass.
And what can make you know what is [breaking through] the difficult pass?
It is the freeing of a slave

verses.arabic: أَوۡ إِطۡعَـٰمࣱ فِی یَوۡمࣲ ذِی مَسۡغَبَةࣲ
verses.translation: Or feeding on a day of severe hunger
verses.transliteration: Aw it'aamun fee yawmin zee masghabah

verses.translation: An orphan of near relationship
Or a needy person in misery

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَوَاصَوۡا۟ بِٱلصَّبۡرِ وَتَوَاصَوۡا۟ بِٱلۡمَرۡحَمَةِ
verses.translation: And then being among those who believed and advised one another to patience and advised one another to compassion.
verses.transliteration: Summa kaana minal lazeena aamanoo wa tawaasaw bissabri wa tawaasaw bilmarhamah

verses.translation: Those are the companions of the right.

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔایَـٰتِنَا هُمۡ أَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ
verses.translation: But they who disbelieved in Our signs - those are the companions of the left.
verses.transliteration: Wallazeena kafaroo bi aayaatinaa hum as-haabul Mash'amah

verses.translation: Over them will be fire closed in.
